newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatian money market trade brisk, supply good.
newsitem.headline: Croatian money market trade brisk, supply good.

text.p: Croatian money market saw a brisk trade on Monday morning amid good supply of fresh kuna funds, dealers said.
"The market had a good day. Almost all demand for new loans has been met," one dealer said.
Fresh loans totalled 29.7 million kuna, against some 70 million new funds on offer. The average lending rate was put at 11.8 percent, she said.
More than half of loans were call money at a steady rate of 11 percent. Two short-term placements were made at 12 and 15 percent and one two-month loan was struck at 16 percent.
Overnight trade at the weekend totalled 7.6 million kuna, as two banks borrowed money to square their positions and one used funds to maintain its mandatory reserves.
